trial_identification.studytitle: Associations between periodontal disease and cardiovascular surrogate endpoints in an adult Indigenous population
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Associations between periodontal disease and cardiovascular surrogate endpoints following periodontal treatment in an adult Indigenous population with moderate/severe periodontal disease

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon
Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: The periodontal intervention involves periodontal therapy ie scaling and root planing of a participant's teeth and gums. It occurs at baseline and takes around half an hour to an hour. A registered dental hygienest provides the care.
interventions.comparator: The usual course of care, which in this case is no care. Periodontal services are not provided in the general course of care remit of publicly funded dental services who provide dental care to Aboriginal populations.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Carotid Intima-Media Thickness (CIMT). Measured using carotid ultrasound

secondaryOutcome.outcome: C-Reactive Protein (CRP), measured by plasma assays Interleukin-6 (IL-6), measured by plasma assays asymmetrical dimethylarginine (ADMA), measured by plasma assays plasma glucose, measured by plasma assays high-/low-density and total cholesterol, measured by plasma assays glucosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c), measured by plasma assays blood pressure, measured by automatic sphygmomanometer body mass index, measured by height and weight waist-hip ratio, measured directly

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Indigenous persons aged 25+ years that have lived in their current location for 2+ years, and who plan to live at their current location for the next 2 years, with moderate/severe periodontal disease
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Those with rheumatic heart disease history or other cardiac conditions requiring antibiotic prophylaxis for prevention of subacute bacterial endocarditis, or with obvious endodontic lesions or other sources of oral infection.

trial_design.concealment:
Participants enrolled through community consultation and screening procedures.
Random allocation to intervention or control group occurs through central randomisation by computer
trial_design.designfeatures: Delayed intervention design; all participants ultimate receive the benefits of the intervention.

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The relationship between periodontal disease and cardiovascular surrogate endpoints, both of which are high among the Indigenous Australian population, is established. This study seeks to explore the prevalence of cardiovascular surrogate endpoints among this population with periodontal disease, and to determine if implementation of a periodontal intervention leads to improved cardiovascular risk outcomes. There may be benefit in applying this model to other areas of Indigenous health research.
